com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getStoreBatchDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getStoreBatchDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getStoreBatchDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getStoreBatchDetails API fetches shipment lines in a batch by calling getShipmentLineList API.

    • Method Detail

      • getStoreBatchDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getStoreBatchDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                          com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException

        The getStoreBatchDetails API fetches shipment lines in a batch by calling getShipmentLineList API.

        Shipment lines with same ItemID and UnitOfMeasure are combined with the quantities added together to form a batch line.

        If no OrderBy element is passed in the input, shipment lines are fetched in the ascending order of PickLocationSeq.

        It is assumed that shipment lines with the same ItemID and UnitOfMeasure have the same DepartmentCode, PickLocation and PickLocationSeq. Therfore, while combining such shipment lines, these attributes are taken from the first shipment line and stamped on the StoreBatchLine

        The API also fetches the totes stored in YFS_STORE_BATCH_LOCATION.

        Batch lines can be filtered using:

        • ItemID and UnitOfMeasure. This will return batch line for that item only. Both the attributes should be passed.
        • BackroomPickComplete flag. If passed as Y, this will return batch lines which are completely picked.
        • StagingComplete flag. If passed as Y, this will return batch lines which are completely staged.


        In a multicolony environment, PrimaryKey or OrganizationCode Fact should be passed to identify the correct colony.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Validations:


          Either StoreBatchKey or BatchNo and OrganizationCode should be passed.

        User Exits:
          This API calls the following user exit.
          com.yantra.pca.ywe.japi.ue.YCDSortBatchLinesUE
          This user exit can be used to implement a custom logic to sort batch lines.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Partial. StoreBatchLine element is not template controlled.
        Since API output has calculated attributes on StoreBatchLine, it is possible to get few extra attributes in the API output in ShipmentLine element

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        A XML document that contains batch details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Yantra exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
